Description: Fragment from the front or back of the horizontal neck opening of a tunic; the main textile is fine, undyed linen, thicker weft threads forming self-stripes, 1 brocaded red wool marker stripe, tapestry wool and linen applied, tapestry ornament; the tapestry band is fragmented - the horizontal neck decoration of a tunic, parts of three cusped compartments each with a hanging lily-type flower in the centre, red with green sepals and stem, with smaller red flowers or buds around it, undyed linen ground, dark blue semi-circular frame with yellow centres, dark blue rectangular border, wave border at top; main textile warp-undyed linen (S/c.32), main textile weft-undyed linen (S/c.21), wool threads (Z spun S ply), the cut edge is turned under along the neck (not selvedge), other edges fragmentary, there is oversewing in linen (S spun Z ply); tapestry with plied warp threads: warp-undyed linen S spun Z ply/c.11), weft-undyed linen (S), yellow, green, red, dark blue wool (S/c.70); two simple selvedges, one end cut and turned under, the other fragmentary
